Albert Einstein - Bringing back Albert Einstein would be an excellent choice as he was one of the most brilliant minds in history. He could provide insights into the latest advancements in science and technology, and his contributions to the field of physics would have a significant impact on our understanding of the universe.

Mahatma Gandhi - Gandhi was a leader who inspired millions with his nonviolent approach to resolving conflicts. He could bring a sense of peace and unity to our world today, and his wisdom and guidance would be invaluable.

Cleopatra - As one of the most powerful and influential women in history, Cleopatra could bring a fresh perspective to our understanding of leadership and politics. She was a skilled diplomat and negotiator, and her ability to navigate complex political situations would be invaluable.

Leonardo da Vinci - Leonardo da Vinci was a true Renaissance man, with interests in art, science, and engineering. Bringing him back to life would allow us to learn from his vast knowledge and experience in these fields.

William Shakespeare - Shakespeare was a master storyteller whose works have had a profound impact on literature and the arts. Bringing him back to life would allow us to learn from his creative genius and his ability to capture the human experience in his writing.
